Emne: Sv: Issue with VAM Pro Vibration Motors – Prolonged/Stuck Vibrations

Hi,
Unfortunately, the update has made things worse.
CPU2 now shows as version 0, even though the firmware flashing process completed without any errors. There were no disconnects during the update, and the software reported that the update was successful.
After this, all motors now show “power disconnect”, no matter what I do.
I’ve already tried:

  *
Reflashing the firmware again
  *
Disconnecting and reconnecting all cables (power and USB)

Please advise on how to proceed, because the vibration motors are now completely unusable.
[cid:2584a4da-7cd4-43b2-81d1-d4ab19c8f14e]
Best regards,
Simen

Emne: Re: Issue with VAM Pro Vibration Motors – Prolonged/Stuck Vibrations

Hi Simen Asphaug,

If your pedals are ProX Ultra, please update to the latest software and firmware to ensure optimal performance and compatibility.

Please first uninstall SIMSONN Manager 2.1.0 from your computer, and then download and install the 2.1.1 version using the provided link.
Once the installation is complete, go to:
Settings → Update → Manual Firmware Update → Select the file pedals-firmware-pedals-proxultra.sfu
After the firmware update is finished, check if the device connects properly.
Next, open the Vibration Test interface to test the vibration function, making sure to select the correct motor type.
We also recommend updating the telemetry data to ensure everything works correctly.
